text:
Kimberly M. Foxx (née Anderson; born April 1972) is an American politician and lawyer. She is the State's Attorney for Cook County, Illinois since 2016.
She manages the nation's second largest prosecutor's office. She won the Democratic nomination for the position on in March 2016, and won the general election in November.
She is the second African American, after Cecil A. Partee, to hold this position.
